DOC.brief_summary: Cardiovascular disease ischemic heart disease # 1 killer Canada . Currently , Cardiac invasive catheterization angiography ( CICA ) gold standard assessment artery heart . However , cardiac catheterization risk prohibit use patient . These risk include : death , heart attack , stroke bleeding . Cardiac compute tomography angiography ( CTA ) new non-invasive technology may enable evaluation patient ' coronary anatomy without expose patient risk invasive cardiac catheterization . The purpose project compare CT angiography ( CTA ) Tc-99m single photon emission compute tomography ( Tc-99m SPECT ) We enroll patient wait CICA refer TC-99m SPECT CTA scan University Ottawa Heart Institute . Consenting patient wait CICA CTA Tc-99m SPECT scan . Consenting patient refer CTA Tc-99m SPECT CTA Tc-99m SPECT random order CICA ( unless order physician ) .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Cardiac Computed Tomographic Angiography ( CTA ) Tc-99m Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography ( SPECT )
DOC.criteria: Patients refer Tc99m SPECT CTA ; Patients refer CICA without precede ( < 12 month ) MPI CTA Previous revascularization ( PCI CABG ) Age < 18 year lack consent Renal Insufficiency ( GFR < 60 ml/min ) Allergy contraindication contrast agent dipyridamole Refractory angina require urgent/emergent coronary angiography Contraindication radiation exposure ( e.g . pregnancy ) Uncontrolled HR Atrial fibrillation , frequent atrial ventricular ectopy ( > 1/minute ) Unable perform 10 second breathhold
